alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 8:59AM MDT until March 16 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City UT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Utah... Santa Clara River At St. George affecting Washington County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers have increased quickly to reach critical levels. The river crested overnight, and is expected to continue to fall through the day Thursday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Santa Clara River At SANTA CLARA AT ST GEORGE. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.7 feet, At 14.7 ft, developments on the lower Santa Clara River near St. George and the St. George golf course will be threatened. Due to a large engineering effort, the Santa Clara River cannot change its course through St. George. As a result, flood damage is now limited to adjacent roads, bridges, and the St. George golf course. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 15.3 feet, or roughly 3780 cubic feet per second (CFS). - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM MDT Thursday was 17.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to fall through the day, and is expected to fall to below flood stage by early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.9 feet. - Flood History...The current stage compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 01/12/2005. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
